segment.source: Stampinf Properties for Driver Projects
segment.target: Stampinf Properties for Driver Projects

segment.source: Sets the properties for the Stampinf tool.
segment.target: Sets the properties for the Stampinf tool.

segment.source: You can use Stampinf to update common INF and INX file directives when you build the driver.
segment.target: You can use Stampinf to update common INF and INX file directives when you build the driver.

segment.source: Setting Stampinf properties for driver projects
segment.target: Setting Stampinf properties for driver projects

segment.source: Open the property pages for your driver project.
segment.target: Open the property pages for your driver project.

segment.source: Right-click the driver project in Solution Explorer and select Properties.
segment.target: Right-click the driver project in Solution Explorer and select Properties.

segment.source: In the property pages for the driver project, click Configuration Properties and then click Stampinf.
segment.target: In the property pages for the driver project, click Configuration Properties and then click Stampinf.

segment.source: Set the properties for the project.
segment.target: Set the properties for the project.

segment.source: If you want to add this property page to your project, so that you can run the Stampinf during the build process, see the WDK and Visual Studio build environment and the Stampinf task.
segment.target: If you want to add this property page to your project, so that you can run the Stampinf during the build process, see the WDK and Visual Studio build environment and the Stampinf task.

segment.source: Stampinf option
segment.target: Stampinf option

segment.source: Description
segment.target: Description

segment.source: Enable Architecture
segment.target: Enable Architecture

segment.source: Enables the replacement of the $ARCH$ variable used in INX files.
segment.target: Enables the replacement of the $ARCH$ variable used in INX files.

segment.source: If enabled, the value specified for Architecture is used.
segment.target: If enabled, the value specified for Architecture is used.

segment.source: If No is specified, the $ARCH$ variable is removed.
segment.target: If No is specified, the $ARCH$ variable is removed.

segment.source: For example, Standard.NT$ARCH$ becomes Standard.NT.
segment.target: For example, Standard.NT$ARCH$ becomes Standard.NT.

segment.source: Architecture
segment.target: Architecture

segment.source: Specifies the architecture string to replace the $ARCH$ variable that is used in INX files.
segment.target: Specifies the architecture string to replace the $ARCH$ variable that is used in INX files.

segment.source: The default value is $(InfArch), a macro that selects the current active configuration in Visual Studio.
segment.target: The default value is $(InfArch), a macro that selects the current active configuration in Visual Studio.

segment.source: Possible values include x86, x64.
segment.target: Possible values include x86, x64.

segment.source: This setting is equivalent to specifying the Stampinf option -a [architecture].
segment.target: This setting is equivalent to specifying the Stampinf option -a [architecture].

segment.source: Enable VersionStamp
segment.target: Enable VersionStamp

segment.source: Enables the version time stamp.
segment.target: Enables the version time stamp.

segment.source: If enabled, the Driver Version Number must not be empty.
segment.target: If enabled, the Driver Version Number must not be empty.

segment.source: The Driver Version Number specifies the time that is written in the INF DriverVer directive for the version number.
segment.target: The Driver Version Number specifies the time that is written in the INF DriverVer directive for the version number.

segment.source: If not enabled, see the description of the default behavior for this option under Driver Version Number.
segment.target: If not enabled, see the description of the default behavior for this option under Driver Version Number.

segment.source: Driver Version Number
segment.target: Driver Version Number

segment.source: Specifies the time that is written in the INF DriverVer directive for the version number.
segment.target: Specifies the time that is written in the INF DriverVer directive for the version number.

segment.source: The format for the time is hours.minutes.seconds.milliseconds (for example, 11.30.20.15).
segment.target: The format for the time is hours.minutes.seconds.milliseconds (for example, 11.30.20.15).

segment.source: This option is useful during development because it provides a convenient way to increase the version number of the driver.
segment.target: This option is useful during development because it provides a convenient way to increase the version number of the driver.

segment.source: This setting is equivalent to specifying the Stampinf option -v [time| *].
segment.target: This setting is equivalent to specifying the Stampinf option -v [time| *].

segment.source: To use the current time, specify an asterisk (*) with this parameter.
segment.target: To use the current time, specify an asterisk (*) with this parameter.

segment.source: Default behavior:
segment.target: Default behavior:

segment.source: If the Driver Version Number is not specified, or if Enable VersionStamp is No or unspecified, Stampinf uses one of the following version number values:
segment.target: If the Driver Version Number is not specified, or if Enable VersionStamp is No or unspecified, Stampinf uses one of the following version number values:

segment.source: If the STAMPINF_VERSION environment variable is set, Stampinf uses the version number value that is specified by this environment variable.
segment.target: If the STAMPINF_VERSION environment variable is set, Stampinf uses the version number value that is specified by this environment variable.

segment.source: If the STAMPINF_VERSION environment variable is not specified, Stampinf extracts the version number from the ntverp.h file.
segment.target: If the STAMPINF_VERSION environment variable is not specified, Stampinf extracts the version number from the ntverp.h file.

segment.source: Note By default, the STAMPINF_VERSION environment variable is not set when you build a driver unless you set it as a system environment variable.
segment.target: Note By default, the STAMPINF_VERSION environment variable is not set when you build a driver unless you set it as a system environment variable.

segment.source: To specify this environment variable within the Visual Studio build environment, see How to: Use Environment Variables in a Build.
segment.target: To specify this environment variable within the Visual Studio build environment, see How to: Use Environment Variables in a Build.

segment.source: Enable DateStamp
segment.target: Enable DateStamp

segment.source: Enables the date stamp.
segment.target: Enables the date stamp.

segment.source: If enabled, the Driver Version Directive Date must not be empty.
segment.target: If enabled, the Driver Version Directive Date must not be empty.

segment.source: If not enabled, see the description of the default behavior for this option under Driver Version Directive Date.
segment.target: If not enabled, see the description of the default behavior for this option under Driver Version Directive Date.

segment.source: Driver Version Directive Date
segment.target: Driver Version Directive Date

segment.source: Specifies the date that is written in the INF DriverVer directive.
segment.target: Specifies the date that is written in the INF DriverVer directive.

segment.source: The format for the date is monthdateyear (for example, 10/20/2011).
segment.target: The format for the date is monthdateyear (for example, 10/20/2011).

segment.source: To use the current date, specify an asterisk () with this parameter.
segment.target: To use the current date, specify an asterisk () with this parameter.

segment.source: Default behavior:
segment.target: Default behavior:

segment.source: If the Driver Version Directive Date parameter is not specified, or if Enable DateStamp is No or unspecified, Stampinf uses one of the following date values:
segment.target: If the Driver Version Directive Date parameter is not specified, or if Enable DateStamp is No or unspecified, Stampinf uses one of the following date values:

segment.source: If the STAMPINF_DATE environment variable is set, Stampinf uses the date value that is specified by this environment variable.
segment.target: If the STAMPINF_DATE environment variable is set, Stampinf uses the date value that is specified by this environment variable.

segment.source: If the STAMPINF_DATE environment variable is not specified, Stampinf uses the current date.
segment.target: If the STAMPINF_DATE environment variable is not specified, Stampinf uses the current date.

segment.source: This setting is equivalent to specifying the Stampinf option -d [date|*].
segment.target: This setting is equivalent to specifying the Stampinf option -d [date|*].

segment.source: Note By default, the STAMPINF_DATE environment variable is not set when you build a driver unless you set it as a system environment variable.
segment.target: Note By default, the STAMPINF_DATE environment variable is not set when you build a driver unless you set it as a system environment variable.

segment.source: To specify this environment variable within the Visual Studio build environment, see How to: Use Environment Variables in a Build.
segment.target: To specify this environment variable within the Visual Studio build environment, see How to: Use Environment Variables in a Build.

segment.source: Driver Version Directive Section
segment.target: Driver Version Directive Section

segment.source: Specifies the INF section in which to put the INF DriverVer directive.
segment.target: Specifies the INF section in which to put the INF DriverVer directive.

segment.source: The default location for this directive is the INF Version section.
segment.target: The default location for this directive is the INF Version section.

segment.source: This setting is equivalent to specifying the Stampinf option -ssection.
segment.target: This setting is equivalent to specifying the Stampinf option -ssection.

segment.source: KMDF Version Number
segment.target: KMDF Version Number

segment.source: Specifies the version of KMDF that this driver depends on.
segment.target: Specifies the version of KMDF that this driver depends on.

segment.source: This is used to customize the KmdfLibraryVersion and KMDF co-installer name in the INF file.
segment.target: This is used to customize the KmdfLibraryVersion and KMDF co-installer name in the INF file.

segment.source: This option replaces the $KMDFVERSION$ and $KMDFCOINSTALLERVERSION$ keywords in the INF file.
segment.target: This option replaces the $KMDFVERSION$ and $KMDFCOINSTALLERVERSION$ keywords in the INF file.

segment.source: The string has the following format:
segment.target: The string has the following format:

segment.source: major_version.minor_version
segment.target: major_version.minor_version

segment.source: For example, if you specify 1.5 as the version string, the values 1.5 and 01005 are used for the two keywords (respectively).
segment.target: For example, if you specify 1.5 as the version string, the values 1.5 and 01005 are used for the two keywords (respectively).

segment.source: This setting is equivalent to specifying the Stampinf option -kKMDFversion.
segment.target: This setting is equivalent to specifying the Stampinf option -kKMDFversion.

segment.source: UMDF Version Number
segment.target: UMDF Version Number

segment.source: Specifies the version of UMDF that this driver depends on.
segment.target: Specifies the version of UMDF that this driver depends on.

segment.source: This option is used to specify the UmdfLibraryVersion and UMDF co-installer name in the INF file.
segment.target: This option is used to specify the UmdfLibraryVersion and UMDF co-installer name in the INF file.

segment.source: The version that is specified replaces the $UMDFVERSION$ and $UMDFCOINSTALLERVERSION$ keywords in the INF file.
segment.target: The version that is specified replaces the $UMDFVERSION$ and $UMDFCOINSTALLERVERSION$ keywords in the INF file.

segment.source: The version string has the following format:
segment.target: The version string has the following format:

segment.source: major_version.minor_version.service_version
segment.target: major_version.minor_version.service_version

segment.source: (where service_version is typically zero).
segment.target: (where service_version is typically zero).

segment.source: For example, if you specify 1.5.0 as the version string, the values 1.5.0 and 01005 are used for the major and minor keywords (respectively).
segment.target: For example, if you specify 1.5.0 as the version string, the values 1.5.0 and 01005 are used for the major and minor keywords (respectively).

segment.source: This setting is equivalent to specifying the Stampinf option -uUMDFversion.
segment.target: This setting is equivalent to specifying the Stampinf option -uUMDFversion.

segment.source: Catalog File Name
segment.target: Catalog File Name

segment.source: Specifies the value that is written in the CatalogFile directive in the INF Version section.
segment.target: Specifies the value that is written in the CatalogFile directive in the INF Version section.

segment.source: By default, the CatalogFile directive is not written.
segment.target: By default, the CatalogFile directive is not written.

segment.source: This setting is equivalent to specifying the Stampinf option -ccatalogfile.
segment.target: This setting is equivalent to specifying the Stampinf option -ccatalogfile.

segment.source: Verbose
segment.target: Verbose

segment.source: Shows verbose Stampinf output.
segment.target: Shows verbose Stampinf output.

segment.source: This setting is equivalent to specifying the Stampinf option -n .
segment.target: This setting is equivalent to specifying the Stampinf option -n .

segment.source: Version Header Path
segment.target: Version Header Path

segment.source: Specifies the location of Ntverp.h file.
segment.target: Specifies the location of Ntverp.h file.

segment.source: The path represent the fully qualified location of the directory containing Ntverp.h.
segment.target: The path represent the fully qualified location of the directory containing Ntverp.h.

segment.source: This setting is equivalent to specifying the Stampinf option -ipath.
segment.target: This setting is equivalent to specifying the Stampinf option -ipath.

segment.source: Related topics
segment.target: Related topics
